author: Anonymous Gear
title: PSET 9 question- TAs at the same time?
question:
Hi!
I saw that we're allowed to ask questions about the PSET9, and I'm a little confused about one of the points for my domain analysis. 
I see the note that a TA can work more than one slot, and I'm wondering (as an example) if we have a list of 5 slots in a tree, and perhaps 3 TAs and only two of those TAs are available at the time "B", couldn't the two available TAs fill those 5 spots themselves, as they would both be at or under their maximum number of spots? Or would this not be allowed because they can't fill multiple slots for a singular lab? 
From the given Data definition, I don't see anything that specifically contradicts this, but I know that in real life this wouldn't work.
instructor_answer:
Many of the questions people have about pset 9 can be answered by asking yourself - what if it happened to me?
In this case, how you would feel if you got to lab and there was only one TA who said they were working all 3 slots?
